trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about one of the graphics modes for a display device

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about one of the graphics modes for a display device

target.mrk: Retrieves information about one of the graphics modes for a display device

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The display device about whose graphics mode the function will obtain information.

seg-source.mrk: The display device about whose graphics mode the function will obtain information.

target.mrk: The display device about whose graphics mode the function will obtain information.

trans-unit.source: An empty string specifies the current display device on the computer on which the calling process is running.

seg-source.mrk: An empty string specifies the current display device on the computer on which the calling process is running.

target.mrk: An empty string specifies the current display device on the computer on which the calling process is running.

trans-unit.source: The type of information to be retrieved. This value can be a graphics mode index or one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: The type of information to be retrieved.
This value can be a graphics mode index or one of the following values:

target.mrk: The type of information to be retrieved.
This value can be a graphics mode index or one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: $ENUM_CURRENT_SETTINGS

target.mrk: $ENUM_CURRENT_SETTINGS

seg-source.mrk: $ENUM_REGISTRY_SETTINGS

target.mrk: $ENUM_REGISTRY_SETTINGS

trans-unit.source: The graphics mode indexes start at zero.

seg-source.mrk: The graphics mode indexes start at zero.

target.mrk: The graphics mode indexes start at zero.

trans-unit.source: To obtain information for all of a display device's graphics modes, make a series of calls to _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings().

seg-source.mrk: To obtain information for all of a display device's graphics modes, make a series of calls to _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings().

target.mrk: To obtain information for all of a display device's graphics modes, make a series of calls to _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings().

trans-unit.source: Set $iMode to zero for the first call, and increment $iMode by one for each subsequent call.

seg-source.mrk: Set $iMode to zero for the first call, and increment $iMode by one for each subsequent call.

target.mrk: Set $iMode to zero for the first call, and increment $iMode by one for each subsequent call.

trans-unit.source: Continue calling the function until the return value is zero.

seg-source.mrk: Continue calling the function until the return value is zero.

target.mrk: Continue calling the function until the return value is zero.

trans-unit.source: When you call _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings() with $iMode set to zero, the operating system initializes and caches information about the display device.

seg-source.mrk: When you call _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings() with $iMode set to zero, the operating system initializes and caches information about the display device.

target.mrk: When you call _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings() with $iMode set to zero, the operating system initializes and caches information about the display device.

trans-unit.source: When you call _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings() with $iMode set to a non-zero value, the function returns the information that was cached the last time the function was called with $iMode set to zero.

seg-source.mrk: When you call _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings() with $iMode set to a non-zero value, the function returns the information that was cached the last time the function was called with $iMode set to zero.

target.mrk: When you call _WinAPI_EnumDisplaySettings() with $iMode set to a non-zero value, the function returns the information that was cached the last time the function was called with $iMode set to zero.

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The array containing the following information:

target.mrk: The array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0] - The width, in pixels, of the visible device surface.

seg-source.mrk: [0] - The width, in pixels, of the visible device surface.

target.mrk: [0] - The width, in pixels, of the visible device surface.

trans-unit.source: [1] - The height, in pixels, of the visible device surface.

seg-source.mrk: [1] - The height, in pixels, of the visible device surface.

target.mrk: [1] - The height, in pixels, of the visible device surface.

trans-unit.source: [2] - The color resolution, in bits per pixel, of the display device.

seg-source.mrk: [2] - The color resolution, in bits per pixel, of the display device.

target.mrk: [2] - The color resolution, in bits per pixel, of the display device.

trans-unit.source: [3] - The frequency, in hertz (cycles per second), of the display device in a particular mode.

seg-source.mrk: [3] - The frequency, in hertz (cycles per second), of the display device in a particular mode.

target.mrk: [3] - The frequency, in hertz (cycles per second), of the display device in a particular mode.

seg-source.mrk: [4] - The device's display mode ($DM_*).

target.mrk: [4] - The device's display mode ($DM_*).

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: See Also
